messages: 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:09): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, prefix syntax on elements
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:10): seems related to issue 41
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:11): what problem would it solve?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:11): i don't understand
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:11): http://www.angularjs.org/
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (09:11): Title: AngularJS (at www.angularjs.org)
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:11): That framework implements a large number of custom widgets and attributes and uses post processing to fill it the DOM nodes
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:12): <ng:include src="'template.html'"></ng:include>
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:13): Less about what problem it solves, but the framework works fine in every browser using that notation.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:13): that's not html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:13): it's just a proprietary language
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:13): So not specifying it seems to deny what browsers already support
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:13): so what html says doesn't seem very relevant
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:14): the rules for parsing that into the DOM structure shouldn't be specified though?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:14): if browsers already handle it consistently
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:14): they are
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:14): ah, where?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:14): the html parser defines how you parse any input
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:14): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete.html#parsing
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (09:14): Title: Web Applications 1.0 (at www.whatwg.org)
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:15): I couldn't find anything about parsing a tag prefix
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:16): The lead developers on that project were asking me about conformance, and I was looking for relevant parts of the spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:17): it's not conforming -- it's not html at all
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:17): there's no "tag prefix" in <ng:foo>, the element is just called "ng:foo"
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:19): What do the parsing rules say about : in the name?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:19): nothing, it's treated the same as "a"
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:21): So then as far as the parser is concerned it's just an unknown element and is inserted into the DOM?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:21): yes
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:22): perfect, thanks
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:23): it might be worth putting something to that effect into the spec near the section on namespaces
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:23): prefix:something is not a namespace, just an known element with name "prefix:something"
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:24): unknown*
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:28): well they're not allowed in either case, so it's not clear what good it would do to mention them
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:28): but i'll file a bug to think about it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:28): ok gotta go sleep now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:28): nn
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:28): They were really confused by the line 'The HTML syntax does not support namespace declarations, even in foreign elements.'
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:28): and thanks again, night
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:29): what's confusing about it?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:31): They noticed that <foo:bar> is treated the same in most/all browsers in terms of DOM construction and parsing
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:31): but then that line seems like a confirming HTML5 browser should not permit it at all
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): so's <fooxbar>
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:31): exactly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): the browser doesn't permit or deny anything
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:31): right, but the : confuses XML namespaces
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:32): so immediately they, and I, looked all over the spec at all sections that mention the word namespace
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:32): "x" doesn't have special meaning in another SGML like language I know of
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): well i filed http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=11338

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (09:33): 11338: contributor, P3, NEW, 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc says we should add a note here saying something like "In the HTML serialization, namespace prefixes and namespace declarations are non-conforming and are do not have the same effect as in XML. In particular, the colon has no special meaning in HTML
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): if you have any idea of a better suggestion for a note than what is in that bug, please write it in teh bug
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): i really must go now :-)
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:33): perfect, you rock :)

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (09:43): bugmail: "[Bug 11338] Elliott Sprehn suggests a note here saying something like "In the HTML serialization, namespace prefixes and namespace declarations are non-conforming and are do not have the same effect as in XML. In particular, the colon has no special meaning in HTML" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2010Nov/0640.html> ** [Bug 11338] New: 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc says we should add a note here saying something like
